title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: neonNitrate dashboard provides powerful, interactive environment exploring nitrate concentrations measured German surface water sites part NEON project. guide walks key features, interpretation tips, usage best practices.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Load package run: dashboard open automatically, check R console local URL paste browser.
code: library(neonNitrate)  # Launch with default settings run_app()  # Launch without auto-opening browser run_app(launch.browser = FALSE)

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: app includes three main tabs accessible via sidebar: Data Overview ‚Äì Snapshot nitrate sample distribution site metadata Temporal Trends ‚Äì Time series visualizations monthly summaries per site Summary & Analysis‚Äì Statistical summaries, cross-site comparisons, export options.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Overview tab presents sample distribution data neonNitrate datasets, showing: many nitrate samples collected site distribution sampling efforts across German NEON sites Summary statistics understand sampling coverage data completeness

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Three summary statistics provide quick overview: Total Sites Surveyed: Number unique NEON sampling sites surveyed Total Samples Collected: Total nitrate samples dataset Date Range Covered: Time span nitrate measurements provide high-level summary dataset‚Äôs scope.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Two collapsible panels provide essential background: neonNitrate Data: Explains nature NEON nitrate sampling use cases Understanding Data Fields: Definitions site, sample count, nitrate concentration, date variables Expand new NEON nitrate data need guidance field meaning.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: main visualization presents spatial numerical distribution nitrate samples: Structure: Bar chart showing sample counts per site Optional tables summarizing site metadata sampling effort interact: Hover bars see exact sample counts Use filtering search (available) focus specific sites Compare sample counts sites identify data density hotspots

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Sampling Imbalance: sites may many samples, others none Temporal Coverage: Confirm sites consistent sampling time Potential Gaps: Identify sites needing data collection review

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Sample Concentration: Heavily sampled sites provide reliable data analysis Site Coverage: Broader site coverage supports generalizability findings Data Quality Checks: Use overview insights guide cleaning quality control efforts

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: tab shows time series visualizations summaries nitrate concentrations reveal temporal patterns different NEON sites.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Three key statistics provide snapshot overview: Total Measurement Dates: Number distinct sampling dates dataset Date Range: Earliest latest measurement date Total Sites Data: Count sites available nitrate measurements help grasp temporal spatial coverage nitrate data.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Site Selector: Choose one multiple sampling sites focus Date Range Slider: Narrow displayed period targeted analysis

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Hover exact value date Toggle site visibility via legend Monthly Summary Plot: Boxplot bar chart summarizing median range nitrate concentrations month site, showing seasonal trends

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Complementary table showing date, site, nitrate concentration filtered data, search sort functionality.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Use site selector compare trends across different locations Zoom filter date seasonal event-focused analysis Hover plot lines examine specific measurement details Export plots tables reporting

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Seasonality Detection: Look recurring patterns spikes nitrate associated seasons events Site Comparisons: Recognize differences temporal trends urban, agricultural, reference sites Anomaly Identification: Detect unusual concentration changes indicating pollution sampling errors Data Gaps: Use date range spot periods limited data targeted follow-

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: tab provides aggregated statistical summaries visual comparisons nitrate levels across sites time, supporting deeper insights.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Displays mean, median, standard deviation, min, max nitrate concentrations grouped site time periods. Sortable searchable interface easy data exploration. Allows exporting summaries reporting.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Boxplots violin plots contrasting nitrate concentration distributions sites chosen periods. Color-coded site visual clarity. Helps detect outliers, skewness, variation.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Select grouping variables site, month, year. Choose nitrate measurement range focused analysis.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Examine summary statistics identify sites high median variability. Visualize distributions detect irregularities site-specific characteristics. Filter data zoom critical periods locations. Export tables plots presentation analysis.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Identify Hotspots: Sites consistently elevated nitrate levels may require targeted investigation. Seasonal Effects: Changes distribution shapes across months can indicate seasonal pollution sources. Data Spread: Wide variation outliers suggest complex site conditions measurement issues. Comparative Insights: Use side--side plots compare sites periods meaningfully.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Sidebar menu: Easily switch main pages: Data Overview, Temporal Trends, Summary & Analysis. Current tab highlight: selected tab visually marked help orientation. Collapsible content sections: Click headings expand minimize explanatory control panels. Breadcrumb navigation: Available hierarchical views quickly backtrack navigate levels.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Hover info: Mouse interactive plots detailed data readouts. Click actions: Select drill clicking specific plot elements. Zoom pan: Use built-tools adjust plot views dynamically. Export options: Save charts images download data tables CSV format offline analysis.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Use --date browsers like Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge best rendering responsiveness. Close unused browser tabs applications free memory processing power. Minimize selection complexity‚Äîlimit filters (e.g., site selection) 2 3 items smoother operation. patient; rendering complex plots large datasets can take moments complete.

what: Why do some nitrate measurements show wide variability or uncertainty?
title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Sample sizes may smaller certain dates sites, especially infrequent sampling periods. Natural variability nitrate levels due environmental factors (rainfall, agriculture, seasonality). Measurement sensor errors can add uncertainty, especially extreme values. variability highlights areas data collection quality checks improve reliability.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: ‚ÄúOverall‚Äù summary aggregates nitrate measurements across sites times within specified filters. separate site combined estimate provide big-picture perspective.

what: Can I export the data and visuals?
title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Yes! Use dashboard‚Äôs download buttons save data tables CSV files. Save plotted graph PNG image using camera icon plot toolbar.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Start Data Overview assess sampling coverage. Investigate temporal trends identify seasonal event-driven changes. Use summarized statistics plots focus critical sites time periods.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Pay attention confidence intervals error bars available. Larger variability suggests caution interpretation need data. Narrow variability suggests reliable estimates.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Use per-site time-based comparisons rather global averages. Consider local land use, weather, management interpreting differences. Avoid -interpreting small variations without contextual knowledge.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Statistical significance may always imply environmental regulatory importance. Consider whether observed changes matter management policy. Prioritize actionable findings.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Record observations interesting patterns. Save visualizations data extracts reproducibility. Note filtering parameters used clarity.

title: neonNitrate Dashboard User Guide
text: Check consistency across tabs metrics. Use multiple plots summaries confirm trends. Seek confirmation external data expert knowledge possible.

title: Introduction to neonNitrate
text: neonNitrate package provides comprehensive set tools analyze visualize surface water nitrate data NEON sites Germany. vignette introduces key functions, interactive features, included datasets environmental monitoring research.

title: Introduction to neonNitrate
text: Nitrate levels crucial indicator assessing nutrient pollution water quality. High concentrations can impact ecosystem health human populations relying water resources.

title: Introduction to neonNitrate
text: package includes processed data products facilitate wide range analyses: neon_nitrate: Full nitrate time series site metadata. nitrate_clean: Cleaned subset nitrate samples. nitrate_sample_distribution: Sampling snapshot (counts per site/period). pop_est: Population site aggregation estimates (relevant). strata_summary: Stratified (group/category) summary statistics.

title: Introduction to neonNitrate
text: install latest version:

title: Introduction to neonNitrate
text: snapshot sampling effort per site: Key variables: - site, n_samples (actual variable names)

title: Introduction to neonNitrate
text: Complete time series measurement detail:
code: head(neon_nitrate) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 10 #>   start_date_time     end_date_time       surf_water_nitrate_mean #>   <dttm>              <dttm>                                <dbl> #> 1 2020-03-01 00:00:00 2020-03-01 00:15:00                     9.6 #> 2 2020-03-01 00:15:00 2020-03-01 00:30:00                     9.6 #> 3 2020-03-01 00:30:00 2020-03-01 00:45:00                     9.6 #> 4 2020-03-01 00:45:00 2020-03-01 01:00:00                     9.6 #> 5 2020-03-01 01:00:00 2020-03-01 01:15:00                     9.6 #> 6 2020-03-01 01:15:00 2020-03-01 01:30:00                     9.6 #> # ‚Ñπ 7 more variables: surf_water_nitrate_minimum <dbl>, #> #   surf_water_nitrate_maximum <dbl>, surf_water_nitrate_variance <dbl>, #> #   surf_water_nitrate_num_pts <dbl>, surf_water_nitrate_exp_uncert <dbl>, #> #   surf_water_nitrate_std_er_mean <dbl>, final_qf <dbl> head(nitrate_sample_distribution) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 2 #>   surf_water_nitrate_mean     n #>                     <dbl> <int> #> 1                    10     427 #> 2                     9.8   423 #> 3                    10.1   322 #> 4                    10.5   312 #> 5                     4.2   303 #> 6                     4.3   296

title: Introduction to neonNitrate
text: detailed analysis group:
code: data(strata_summary) head(strata_summary) #> # A tibble: 4 √ó 6 #>    year month mean_nitrate min_nitrate max_nitrate     n #>   <dbl> <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl>       <dbl> <int> #> 1  2020     3        10.4          9.6        11.7  2976 #> 2  2020     4        14.9         11          24    2880 #> 3  2020     5        10.3          6.9        20.1  2970 #> 4  2020     6         4.90         3.2         9    2594

title: Introduction to neonNitrate
text: launch interactive Shiny dashboard: see ‚Äúlocate Shiny app directory,‚Äù ensure app inst/app/ referenced correctly run_app().

title: Introduction to neonNitrate
code: library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)  data("nitrate_sample_distribution", package = "neonNitrate")  ggplot(nitrate_sample_distribution, aes(x = surf_water_nitrate_mean, y = n)) +   geom_col(fill = "#009E73") +   labs(     title = "Samples Collected per Nitrate Concentration",     x = "Mean Surface Water Nitrate (mg/L)",     y = "Number of Samples"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Introduction to neonNitrate
code: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(neonNitrate)  data("neon_nitrate", package = "neonNitrate")  # Convert start_date_time to Date neon_nitrate <- neon_nitrate %>%   mutate(start_date_time = as.Date(start_date_time))  # Time series plot of mean nitrate ggplot(neon_nitrate, aes(x = start_date_time, y = surf_water_nitrate_mean)) +   geom_line(group = 1, color = "#0072B2") +   geom_point(alpha = 0.5, color = "#D55E00") +   labs(     title = "Temporal Patterns of Surface Water Nitrate",     x = "Date",     y = "Mean Surface Water Nitrate (mg/L)"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Introduction to neonNitrate
code: ggplot(neon_nitrate, aes(x = surf_water_nitrate_mean, y = surf_water_nitrate_variance)) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.6, color = "#E69F00") +   labs(     title = "Relationship Between Mean and Variance of Nitrate Measurements",     x = "Mean Surface Water Nitrate (mg/L)",     y = "Variance of Nitrate Measurements"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: neonNitrate: German Surface Water Nitrate Analysis
text: neonNitrate package provides interactive dashboard tools exploring nitrate concentration related water-quality variables freshwater ecosystems. uses open-access data National Ecological Observatory Network (NEON), focusing nitrate dynamics across U.S. monitoring sites. Developed ETC5523 ‚Äì Communicating Data (Assignment 4) Monash University. üìä Package Website: neonNitrate neonNitrate pkgdown site

title: neonNitrate: German Surface Water Nitrate Analysis
text: üíß Cleaned NEON nitrate dataset üåé Interactive Shiny dashboard visualization üìà Time-series correlation plots nitrate temperature üßÆ Summary statistics site time üìù Vignettes documentation using roxygen2

neonNitrate: German Surface Water Nitrate Analysis
neonNitrate: German Surface Water Nitrate Analysis
neonNitrate: German Surface Water Nitrate Analysis
text: Launch Shiny dashboard explore data interactively: Shiny dashboard includes three key sections: - Overview ‚Äì Explore nitrate levels site year - Time-Series Trends ‚Äì Visualize seasonal nitrate variation - Variable Correlations ‚Äì Compare nitrate turbidity, temperature, conductivity

title: neonNitrate: German Surface Water Nitrate Analysis
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2)  # Example dataset nitrate_clean <- data.frame(   siteID = rep("BARC", 12),   datetime = seq(as.Date("2020-01-01"), by = "month", length.out = 12),   nitrate_mgL = runif(12, 0.5, 3.5) )  nitrate_clean |>   mutate(month = format(datetime, "%b")) |>   group_by(month) |>   summarise(mean_nitrate = mean(nitrate_mgL, na.rm = TRUE)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = month, y = mean_nitrate)) +   geom_col(fill = "steelblue") +   labs(     title = "Average Monthly Nitrate Concentration ‚Äì BARC Site",     x = "Month",     y = "Nitrate (mg/L)"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: neonNitrate: German Surface Water Nitrate Analysis
text: nitrate_clean ‚Äì Cleaned NEON nitrate dataset nitrate_summary ‚Äì Summarized nitrate data site month

title: neonNitrate: German Surface Water Nitrate Analysis
text: run_app() - Launch Shiny dashboard summarize_nitrate() - Compute nitrate statistics time site plot_nitrate_trends() - Generate time-series visualizations

title: neonNitrate: German Surface Water Nitrate Analysis
text: Package Website

title: NEON Nitrate Survey Data ‚Äî neon_nitrate
text: Surface water nitrate data collected NEON COM sites.

title: NEON Nitrate Survey Data ‚Äî neon_nitrate
text: data frame one row per 15-minute sample: start_date_time Start time sample (POSIXct) end_date_time End time sample (POSIXct) surf_water_nitrate_mean Mean water nitrate concentration (mg/L) surf_water_nitrate_minimum Minimum nitrate concentration (mg/L) surf_water_nitrate_maximum Maximum nitrate concentration (mg/L) surf_water_nitrate_variance Variance nitrate values surf_water_nitrate_num_pts Number measurements interval surf_water_nitrate_exp_uncert Experimental uncertainty surf_water_nitrate_std_er_mean Standard error mean final_qf Quality flag

title: NEON Nitrate Survey Data ‚Äî neon_nitrate
text: NEON project: COMO site nitrate data, https://data.neonscience.org/

title: NEON Nitrate Survey Data ‚Äî neon_nitrate
text: Data derived high-frequency COM site sensors, cleaned remove missing values mean nitrate timestamps.

title: NEON Nitrate Survey Data ‚Äî neon_nitrate
code: data(neon_nitrate) summary(neon_nitrate$surf_water_nitrate_mean) #>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max.  #>    3.20    7.20   10.10   10.24   12.50   24.00  head(neon_nitrate) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 10 #>   start_date_time     end_date_time       surf_water_nitrate_mean #>   <dttm>              <dttm>                                <dbl> #> 1 2020-03-01 00:00:00 2020-03-01 00:15:00                     9.6 #> 2 2020-03-01 00:15:00 2020-03-01 00:30:00                     9.6 #> 3 2020-03-01 00:30:00 2020-03-01 00:45:00                     9.6 #> 4 2020-03-01 00:45:00 2020-03-01 01:00:00                     9.6 #> 5 2020-03-01 01:00:00 2020-03-01 01:15:00                     9.6 #> 6 2020-03-01 01:15:00 2020-03-01 01:30:00                     9.6 #> # ‚Ñπ 7 more variables: surf_water_nitrate_minimum <dbl>, #> #   surf_water_nitrate_maximum <dbl>, surf_water_nitrate_variance <dbl>, #> #   surf_water_nitrate_num_pts <dbl>, surf_water_nitrate_exp_uncert <dbl>, #> #   surf_water_nitrate_std_er_mean <dbl>, final_qf <dbl>

title: NEON Nitrate Observation Coverage ‚Äî pop_est
text: data frame: total_obs Total number cleaned observations start_range Earliest sample time end_range Latest sample time

what: Launch the NEON Nitrate Interactive Dashboard ‚Äî run_app
title: Launch the NEON Nitrate Interactive Dashboard ‚Äî run_app
text: Launches interactive Shiny dashboard exploring NEON nitrate dataset. dashboard includes visualizations summaries : Sample distributions interactive plots Time series monthly summaries Data filtering quality control visualizations

title: Launch the NEON Nitrate Interactive Dashboard ‚Äî run_app
Launch the NEON Nitrate Interactive Dashboard ‚Äî run_app
text: ... Additional arguments passed runApp. Common options include: port: Port number (e.g., port = 3838) launch.browser: Logical; open app browser (default: TRUE) host: Host IP address (default: "127.0.0.1")

title: Launch the NEON Nitrate Interactive Dashboard ‚Äî run_app
text: Launches Shiny application; return value.

what: Launch the NEON Shiny Dashboard App ‚Äî run_dashboard
title: Launch the NEON Shiny Dashboard App ‚Äî run_dashboard
text: Opens interactive dashboard visualizing NEON nitrate data.

title: Launch the NEON Shiny Dashboard App ‚Äî run_dashboard

text: Monthly summary statistics nitrate values year month.

title: NEON Monthly Nitrate Summary ‚Äî strata_summary
text: data frame: year Year month Month mean_nitrate Mean concentration min_nitrate Minimum concentration max_nitrate Maximum concentration n Sample count

title: Summarize NEON Nitrate Data ‚Äî summarise_nitrate
text: Returns quick summary statistics coverage nitrate dataset.

title: Summarize NEON Nitrate Data ‚Äî summarise_nitrate
text: data cleaned NEON nitrate tibble (default: neon_nitrate).

title: Summarize NEON Nitrate Data ‚Äî summarise_nitrate
text: tibble; summary table core statistics.

title: Summarize NEON Nitrate Data ‚Äî summarise_nitrate
code: summarise_nitrate(neon_nitrate) #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 6 #>   n_obs avg_nitrate min_nitrate max_nitrate period_start        #>   <int>       <dbl>       <dbl>       <dbl> <dttm>              #> 1 11420        10.2           3        24.8 2020-03-01 00:00:00 #> # ‚Ñπ 1 more variable: period_end <dttm>
